title: 1 Corinthians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 1 Corinthians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 16 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the brother mentioned alongside Paul as a co-sender of the letter to the Corinthians?
questions.explanation: Paul begins the letter mentioning Sosthenes as a brother with him.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 1, what is the main cause of divisions among the Corinthians?
questions.explanation: The Corinthians were divided as some said, 'I am of Paul,' others, 'I am of Apollos,' etc.

questions.question: What was Paul’s stated purpose in baptizing only a few in Corinth?
options: To avoid boasting among the believers
Because he was not allowed to baptize
He was focusing on preaching only
questions.correctAnswer: To avoid boasting among the believers
questions.explanation: Paul baptized only a few so no one could say they were baptized in his name.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the ______ of God.'
questions.explanation: The preaching of the cross is described as the power of God to those who are saved.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the wisdom of this world compared to God’s wisdom?
options: God’s foolishness is wiser than men
God’s wisdom is hidden from all men
questions.correctAnswer: God’s foolishness is wiser than men
questions.explanation: Paul states that the foolishness of God is wiser than men.

questions.question: True or False: Paul refers to the Corinthians as being enriched in all utterance and knowledge.
questions.explanation: Paul thanks God that the Corinthians are enriched in all utterance and knowledge.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 3, what are believers described as being in relation to God’s temple?
questions.explanation: Believers are called God’s building and the temple of God.

questions.question: Who does Paul say will judge the work of each man according to 1 Corinthians 3?
questions.explanation: God will judge each man’s work by fire.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that he is not concerned about being judged by men or by his own judgment.
questions.explanation: Paul states he judges not himself and is not concerned about human judgment.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the kingdom of God in 1 Corinthians 4?
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that the kingdom of God is not in word but in power.

questions.question: Who is described as Paul's beloved son and faithful in the Lord, sent to remind the Corinthians of Paul's ways?
questions.explanation: Paul sent Timotheus to remind the Corinthians of his ways in Christ.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For though ye have ten thousand ______ in Christ, yet have ye not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.'
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts instructors with fathers in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 6, what will the unrighteous NOT inherit?
questions.explanation: Paul warns that unrighteous people will not inherit the kingdom of God.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs believers to settle disputes among themselves rather than going before the unbelievers.
questions.explanation: Paul encourages resolving disputes within the church.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the body in 1 Corinthians 6 regarding sin?
options: The body is a temple of the Holy Ghost
The body is separate from the spirit
questions.correctAnswer: The body is a temple of the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Paul states the body is the temple of the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ, and make them the members of a ______?'
questions.explanation: Paul rhetorically asks if believers would make Christ’s members members of a harlot.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7, what does Paul say about marriage to avoid fornication?
options: It is good for a man to marry multiple wives
Every man should have his own wife and every woman her own husband
Celibacy is the only holy state
questions.correctAnswer: Every man should have his own wife and every woman her own husband
questions.explanation: Paul advises marriage to avoid fornication.

questions.question: True or False: Paul commands wives to depart from their husbands if they believe differently.
questions.explanation: Paul says if the unbelieving spouse consents to dwell, let them not depart.

questions.question: Who does Paul describe as sanctified by the believing spouse in 1 Corinthians 7?
questions.explanation: The unbelieving spouse is sanctified by the believer.

questions.question: What does Paul say about remaining in the same calling in 1 Corinthians 7?
options: Seek to change your calling often
Abide in the same calling wherein you were called
Only servants should change their calling
Only free men should change their calling
questions.correctAnswer: Abide in the same calling wherein you were called
questions.explanation: Paul advises believers to remain in their calling.

questions.question: True or False: Paul states that circumcision or uncircumcision is nothing but keeping God’s commandments is what matters.
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes obedience over external rituals.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 8, what is Paul’s main concern about eating meat offered to idols?
options: It might cause a weaker brother to stumble
It is forbidden by the law
questions.correctAnswer: It might cause a weaker brother to stumble
questions.explanation: Paul stresses love that considers the conscience of the weak.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol's temple, shall not the ______ which is weak be emboldened to eat those things offered to idols?'
questions.explanation: Paul warns knowledge should not cause a brother to stumble.

questions.question: Who does Paul say is the head of every man in 1 Corinthians 11?
questions.explanation: Paul states the head of every man is Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul say about a woman praying or prophesying with her head uncovered?
questions.explanation: Paul says a woman praying with her head uncovered dishonors her head.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that the Lord's Supper is to be taken in a manner unworthy of the Lord.
questions.explanation: Paul admonishes to partake worthily, discerning the Lord's body.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12, what is given to each man for the profit of all?
questions.explanation: Spiritual gifts are distributed for the common good.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same ______.'
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that all gifts come from the same Spirit.

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use in 1 Corinthians 12 to describe the church and its members?
questions.explanation: Paul compares the church to a body with many members having different functions.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that no member of the body can say to another, 'I have no need of thee.'
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes the interdependence of the body’s members.

questions.question: What does Paul say about love in 1 Corinthians 13 compared to spiritual gifts?
options: Love is less important than gifts
questions.explanation: Paul declares love is greater than all spiritual gifts.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a characteristic of love in 1 Corinthians 13?
questions.explanation: Love is described as joyful, among other virtues.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that without love, all knowledge and faith profit nothing.
questions.explanation: He stresses that love is essential for the value of all gifts.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14, what should be done if someone speaks in an unknown tongue in the church service?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs that tongues must be interpreted for the church's edification.

questions.question: True or False: Paul encourages prophesying over speaking in tongues for the edification of the church.
questions.explanation: Prophesying builds up the church more clearly than tongues without interpretation.

questions.question: What does Paul say about women in the church in 1 Corinthians 14?
options: They should pray and prophesy with their heads uncovered
They should keep silence and be in subjection
questions.correctAnswer: They should keep silence and be in subjection
questions.explanation: Paul instructs women to keep silence in the churches.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Let all things be done decently and in ______.'
questions.explanation: Paul calls for orderly worship in the church.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 15, what does Paul declare about Christ’s resurrection?
options: Christ rose the third day according to the scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: Christ rose the third day according to the scriptures
questions.explanation: Paul confirms the literal resurrection of Christ on the third day.

questions.question: True or False: Paul teaches that if Christ be not risen, then our faith is vain and we are yet in our sins.
questions.explanation: The resurrection is foundational to Christian faith.

questions.question: What is the 'last enemy' that shall be destroyed according to 1 Corinthians 15?
questions.explanation: Paul says the last enemy destroyed is death.

questions.question: What kind of body does Paul say the resurrected will have in 1 Corinthians 15?
questions.explanation: The resurrection body is called a spiritual body.

questions.question: True or False: Paul exhorts the Corinthians to always abound in the work of the Lord because their labor is not in vain.
questions.explanation: Paul encourages steadfast service knowing it has eternal value.

questions.question: Who does Paul say will deliver the Corinthians from the bondage of corruption according to 1 Corinthians 15?
questions.explanation: Paul says the Lord Jesus will transform our bodies to immortality.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 16, where does Paul instruct the Corinthians to put by themselves in store on the first day of the week?
questions.explanation: Paul advises setting aside money weekly for the saints.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Be ye ______, and quit you like men, and be strong.'
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts the Corinthians to be watchful and strong.
